thread.title: Napier's McLean Park stripped of South Africa ODI due to 'unacceptable risk' as Hamilton gets bonus match
thread.title_full: Napier's McLean Park stripped of South Africa ODI due to 'unacceptable risk' as Hamilton gets bonus match

author: Mark Geenty
title: Napier's McLean Park stripped of South Africa ODI due to 'unacceptable risk' as Hamilton gets bonus match
text:
Napier's McLean Park stripped of South Africa ODI due to 'unacceptable risk' as Hamilton gets bonus match MARK GEENTY Last updated 16:14, February 14 2017 ANDREW CORNAGA/PHOTOSPORT 
Head groundsman Phil Stoyanoff tries to dry the outfield for the Australia ODI which was washed out in Napier. 
Napier has been stripped of host status for the South Africa cricket ODI on March 1 due to an "unacceptable risk" of another washout. 
Instead Hamilton's Seddon Park will host the fourth ODI, after McLean Park's poor drainage led to this month's match being abandoned without a ball bowled. 
"An investigation into the circumstances surrounding the recently abandoned ODI against Australia at McLean Park has highlighted a need for urgent remedial work on the venue's turf, drainage, and irrigation system," an NZC statement said. HAGEN HOPKINS/GETTY IMAGES 
Umpires Kumar Dharmasena and Chris Brown talk to captains Kane Williamson of New Zealand and Aaron Finch of Australia before the second ODI was washed out without a ball bowled in Napier. 
"Consequently, both New Zealand Cricket and the Napier City Council agree it's in the best interests of McLean Park's cricketing future to move the upcoming ODI, and avoid what has been described as 'an unacceptable risk' of a repeat drainage failure." 
MORE TO FOLLOW
